en: I just want to make sure
desc:
"I wanna make sure" implies that the speaker is going to take some action to ensure that something is true or certain. It suggests that the speaker is actively involved in the process of making sure, and may be checking or verifying something to confirm it.

On the other hand, "I wanna be sure" simply expresses the desire for certainty without necessarily implying any specific action on the part of the speaker. It suggests that the speaker wants to be certain about something, but may not be actively involved in the process of making sure.

fa: کسی داره روی این کار می کنه؟
desc:
The main difference between "anyone" and "anybody" is their usage in certain contexts. "Anyone" is more commonly used in formal contexts, while "anybody" is more commonly used in informal contexts. For example, in a job interview, it would be more appropriate to use "anyone" when asking if there are any questions, while in casual conversation with friends, "anybody" would be more common.

Another subtle difference is that "anyone" may be used to refer to a group of people, while "anybody" is generally used to refer to an individual. For example, "Anyone who wants to participate can sign up" refers to a group of people, while "Does anybody want to come with me?" refers to an individual person.

desc:
The word "off" is a preposition that is used to indicate movement from a surface, and in this case, it indicates the action of jumping away from the surface of the building.

On the other hand, "of" is a preposition that indicates a relationship between two nouns or pronouns, such as "the roof of the building." Using "of" instead of "off" in this sentence would be grammatically incorrect and would change the meaning of the sentence.

fa: خانواده من الان در حال خوردن شام هستند
en: My family is having supper now
desc:
"Dinner" traditionally referred to the main meal of the day, which was eaten in the early afternoon. In some cultures, such as the United Kingdom, "dinner" is still used to refer to the main meal of the day, typically eaten in the evening.

"Supper," on the other hand, traditionally referred to a lighter meal that was eaten in the evening. In some regions, such as the southern United States, "supper" is still used to refer to the evening meal.

fa: حالم از این بچه ها خیلی بهم میخوره

fa: ناراحت نمیشی رانندگی کنی؟ من احساس خستگی می کنم و ممنون می شوم اگر بتوانید فرمان را بگیرید
en: Would you mind driving? I'm feeling tired and would appreciate it if you could take the wheel
desc:
"Would you mind driving?": This is a question asking if the person is willing to drive. It is a polite way to inquire if they have any objection or if it would be a problem for them to drive.

"You don't mind driving": This is a statement assuming or confirming that the person is willing to drive. It suggests that the speaker believes the person is okay with driving and does not have any objections.

In summary, the first phrase asks for permission or willingness to drive, while the second phrase assumes or confirms the person's willingness to drive.

desc:
"We may not be giving them enough credit for what they know."
This sentence suggests an ongoing or continuous action of not giving enough credit. It implies that there is a pattern or tendency of underestimating or undervaluing their knowledge.

"We may not give them enough credit for what they know."
This sentence presents a more general statement about not giving enough credit. It does not specifically imply a continuous action, but rather suggests that there may be instances or situations where credit is not adequately given.

fa: او (زن) همیشه به هر سوالی پاسخ رک می دهد
en: She always gives a straight answer to any question
desc:
In English, the most common sentence structure is subject + verb + object. This structure is known as a basic declarative sentence. 
 Adverbs can be placed before or after the verb they modify. In this case, "always" comes before the verb "gives" to indicate that the action of giving a straight answer is consistently performed. So, the corrected sentence structure is subject + adverb + verb + object.

fa: او (مرد) سعی کرد قاب عکس کج را روی دیوار درست کند

fa: سعی کردم موهای مجعدم را صاف کنم، اما همیشه به حالت طبیعی خود برمی گشت
en: I tried to straighten my curly hair, but it always reverted back to its natural state
It's cheap. It's not too expensive
What is it called in English?
I'm sorry to have troubled you
desc:
In this sentence, "I am sorry" expresses regret or apology, and "to have troubled you" provides additional information about the action for which the speaker is sorry. The infinitive phrase "to have troubled you" functions as the direct object or complement of the verb "sorry," specifying the reason or cause for the apology.

The structure "to + have + past participle" is commonly used in English to express actions or events that occurred in the past. In this case, it indicates that the speaker is apologizing for causing trouble or inconvenience to the person being addressed.

fa: تاریخ و محل تولدت کی هست؟

fa: از آنجایی که همه خواهر و برادرهایش (زن) بسیار بزرگتر بودند، او اغلب در کودکی کسی را نداشت که با او بازی کند
en: As all her siblings were much older, she often had no one to play with as a child

fa: من خواهرزاده و برادرزاده ام را دوست دارم
en: I like my niece and nephew

fa: مادرم خیلی به عروس و دامادش احترام می گذارد
en: My mother respects her daughter-in-law and son-in-law very much

fa: همسرم با برادر شوهر و خواهرشوهرش رابطه خوبی دارد
en: My wife has a good relationship with her brother-in-law and sister-in-law

fa: او (مرد) در پی یک تصادف رانندگی بد شکل شد
en: He was disfigured following a car accident
I need to tie my shoelaces (شو لی سِس)
desc:
"I need to tie my shoelaces" implies that it would be beneficial or necessary for the person to tie their shoelaces. It suggests a personal need or preference, emphasizing that it would be advantageous or appropriate to do so.

"I have to tie my shoelaces" expresses a stronger sense of obligation or requirement. It indicates that there is a necessity or compulsion for the person to tie their shoelaces. It suggests that it is essential or mandatory to perform the action.

The phrase "Things have changed" implies that there has been a general alteration or shift in circumstances or situations. It suggests that the state of things is different from what it was before, without specifying who or what caused the change.

On the other hand, "Things have been changed" suggests that someone or something has intentionally made alterations to the state of things. It implies that an external force or agent has actively brought about the change.

In summary, "Things have changed" focuses on the outcome of a general alteration, while "Things have been changed" highlights the action or intervention that caused the alteration.

en: What do you have in your mind?

fa: چیزی که او (مرد) گفت درست نیست
en: What he said is not true
I gotta get out of here
desc: I have got to get out of here

fa: فیلم ساعت چند شروع می شود؟
en: What time does the movie begin?
What do you recommend for dinner?
Keep your voice down or Lower your voice

fa: هدف اسپرینت یه کم واضح نیست
en: The sprint goal is a little fluffy
desc: In the context of project management and agile development methodologies, the sentence "The sprint goal is a little fluffy" suggests that the sprint goal, which is the objective or target for a specific iteration of work within a project, lacks clarity or specificity.

fa: بعضی وقت ها بعد از ناهار هوس می کنم یک تکه شکلات بخورم
en: Sometimes I get an urge to eat a piece of chocolate after lunch

fa: چیزی که من را در مورد او (مرد) آزار می دهد، بی خیالی اوست
en: What annoys me about him is his complacency (کام پلی سنسی)

fa: هرچه دامنه واژگان خود را بیشتر گسترش دهید، مطمئن تر و طبیعی تر در زبان انگلیسی به نظر خواهید بود
en: The more you expand your vocabulary range, the more confident and natural you will sound in English

fa: قیمت های بالا دارد بسیاری از زوج های جوان را از خرید خانه ها منصرف می کند
en: High prices are deterring many young couples from buying houses
desc: By using the plural form, it conveys the idea that there are multiple potential houses that young couples could buy, but they are being deterred by the high prices. It implies a broader impact on the housing market, affecting a range of houses rather than just one specific house.

fa: رفتار بی پروا او باعث شد تا از مدرسه محروم شود
en: His reckless behavior is what caused him to be suspended from school

fa: آیا می تونیم صورتحسابمون را داشته باشیم؟
en: Could we have our bill please?
The teacher is next to the board

fa: کره زمین روی قفسه کتاب است
en: The globe is on the bookcase
There's a clock on the wall

fa: دستیار معلم ساعتی را بالای تابلوی اعلانات گذاشت
en: The teacher's aide put a clock above the bulletin board

fa: من سطل زباله، پاک کن، تراش، دفتر مارپیچ، کلاسور، کاغذ گراف، خط کش، گچ و پونز می خرم
en: I buy wastebasket, eraser, sharpener, spiral notebook (اسپایرل), binder (بایندر), graph paper, ruler, chalk (چاک) and thumbtack (ثام تک)
Take out the piece of paper

fa: تست ها را دست به دست کنید
کلمات را به ترتیب قرار دهید
شما هر روز چه کار می کنید؟ بلند می شوم، دوش می گیرم و دندان هایم را مسواک می زنم
en: What do you do everyday? I get up, take a shower and brush my teeth

fa: او (زن) آرایش می کند و موهایش را شانه می کند
en: She puts on make-up and combs her hair

fa: او ظرف ها را می شست، اتو می کشد و به نوزاد غذا می دهد
en: She washes the dishes, irons, and feeds the baby

fa: اگر عجله نکنید قطار را از دست خواهید داد
en: If you don't hurry you will miss the train

fa: آن چیزی که به نظر می رسد نیست
en: It's not what it looks like

fa: با آرزوی موفقیت برای همه شما در مسابقات باقی ماندهتان، صرف نظر از اینکه در کدام مسیر هستید
en: Good Luck to all of you in your remaining matches, regardless on which track your are

fa: وقتی افراد نامناسبی را ترقی می دهی، شما شروع می کنید به از دست دادن بهترین افراد خود
en: When you promote the wrong people, you begin to lose your best people

fa: چرا من  ( از شدت درد یا ترس ) عقب نکشیدم
به رئیسم گفتم که برای یک عکس ژست بگیرد
en: I told my boss to pose for a picture

fa: شترمرغ بزرگترین پرنده جهان است, قد می کشد تا ۲.۷ متر و وزنش بالا می رود تا ۱۴۵ کیلوگرم
en: The Ostrich is the largest bird in the world, standing up to 2.7 meters tall and weighing up to 145 kilograms

fa: هرگز از طرف من صحبت نکن
پیراهن یک نقطه لکه دار کوچک رویش داشت
en: The shirt had a small stained spot on it

fa: سعی کنید دهان خود را پاک کنید
وقتی کار همکارم تمام شد، پیش شما خواهد آمد
en: When my colleague is done, he will come to you

fa: من حشره را له می کنم
من می تونم چشم غره برم
من هنوز نمی توانم باهاش کنار بیام
en: I still can't get over it
For your information, you're making a mistake

fa: چیز دیگری هست که بخواهی به ما بگی؟
en: Is there anything else you want to tell us

fa: پشت هر مرد موفقی یک زن است
en: Behind every successful man there is a woman
I didn't say anything. Are you sure?

fa: او (مرد) همیشه کار درست را انجام می دهد
en: He always does the right thing

fa: آخرین باری که به اینجا آمدی کی بود؟
en: When was the last time you came here?
